articles.title: Australian firm in talks over massive Congo hydro project | Fin24 - News24
articles.description: Major Australian mining firm Fortescue confirmed Tuesday that it is in talks to develop what is slated to be the world's largest hydroelectric project, in the Democratic Republic of Congo.
articles.content:
• The long-mooted Inga project could eclipse China's Three Gorges Dam.
  • The project has been beset with problems, not least political instability in the Democratic Republic of Congo.
